channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Z and young millennials are driving a great American drinking decline, Gallup poll shows
item.description: About two-thirds of 18- to 34-year-olds believe moderate drinking is unhealthy, according to the poll, up from about four in 10 in 2015.

item.title: Trump to visit Kennedy Center to announce 2025 honorees and promote major changes to the venue
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will visit the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts on Wednesday to unveil its 2025 honorees for artistic excell...

item.title: Match Group agrees to pay $14 million to the FTC for misleading ads
item.description: Company faced deceptive business charges from 2019.

item.title: Ikea retailer Ingka Group announces first non-Swede CEO
item.description: The world’s biggest retailer of IKEA furniture said on Wednesday CEO Jesper Brodin was stepping down after eight years, to be succeeded by Spaniard Ju...

item.title: Neuroscience Says This Is How to Remember Things You Think You’ve Forgotten
item.description: Research shows a memory that seems to be gone forever may just be dormant.

item.title: Parents are rushing to do their back-to-school shopping this year as potential tariff price hikes loom

item.title: Kodak’s corporate doom: 133-year-old photo icon warns investors it may cease operations with $500 million debt problem
item.description: "They blew their future," one expert said.

item.title: For Retail Brands, This 1 Tactic Is Essential for Sustained Growth
item.description: Smart multichannel fulfillment solutions will help facilitate long-term success.

item.title: How Entrepreneurship Saved Ron Holloway’s Life
item.description: The co-founder of Woofbowl discusses his mental health journey with Seth Goldman, co-founder of Honest Tea and Eat the Change.

item.title: Financial firms from Stripe to Circle are building their own blockchains—here’s why
item.description: Stripe is developing what it calls Tempo, and Circle announced Tuesday that it’s building a protocol called Arc.

item.title: If Your Company Used Workday to Hire People, It Could Face Legal Trouble. Here’s Why
item.description: The widening scope of an age discrimination lawsuit against the hiring platform could ensnare thousands of of companies.

item.title: AI is already creating a billionaire boom: There are now 498 AI unicorns—and they’re worth $2.7 trillion
item.description: AI is attracting wealth faster than a ChatGPT search, bringing in more billion-dollar valuations than the dot-com boom has ever seen.

item.title: Cava Group restaurant sales are up, but the stock is tanking. Steak lovers might be part of the reason why

item.title: A federal judge will soon determine if ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ construction in Florida’s Everglades should be blocked indefinitely
item.description: A federal judge is set to hear closing arguments Wednesday over whether to stop construction indefinitely at an immigrant detention center in the Flor...

item.title: Your Answers to 5 Simple Questions Can Tell You If You’re Aging Well
item.description: Research says we’re not doomed to decline nearly as fast as we fear, as long as we maintain these five pillars of healthy aging.
